intro: Liabum boyacense, commonly known as the Boyacá liabum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Liabum boyacense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
